gw.plugin.claimnumbergen

Interface IClaimNumGenAdapter

  • All Superinterfaces:
    com.guidewire.pl.system.integration.plugins.internal.InternalPlugin, java.rmi.Remote

    public interface IClaimNumGenAdapter
extends com.guidewire.pl.system.integration.plugins.internal.InternalPlugin
    IClaimNumGen represents the interface to an external system that mints a new, unique claim number. It's assumed that every time this interface is called, a new, unique claim number is returned.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void cancelNewClaimNumber(Claim claim, java.lang.String claimNumber)
      Cancel a previously allocated claim number.
      java.lang.String generateNewClaimNumber(Claim claim)
      Get a unique identifier for a new claim.
      java.lang.String generateTempClaimNumber(Claim claim)
      Get a unique identifier for a draft claim.

    • Method Detail

      • generateNewClaimNumber

        java.lang.String generateNewClaimNumber(Claim claim)
        Get a unique identifier for a new claim.
        Parameters:
        claim - The claim on which the generated claim number will be set. This claim should be treated as read-only within the context of the plugin.
        Returns:
        A non-null unique identifier of the claim. The string cannot be empty or consist solely of whitespace characters.

      • generateTempClaimNumber

        java.lang.String generateTempClaimNumber(Claim claim)
        Get a unique identifier for a draft claim. This method is called when the claim is first created but doesn't have complete data yet. The method generateNewClaimNumber(Claim) will be called for a permanent claim number when the claim's data is complete (and it is about to be opened).
        Parameters:
        claim - The claim on which the generated claim number will be set. This claim should be treated as read-only within the context of the plugin.
        Returns:
        A non-null unique identifier of the claim. The string cannot be empty or consist solely of whitespace characters.
        See Also:
        generateNewClaimNumber(Claim)

      • cancelNewClaimNumber

        void cancelNewClaimNumber(Claim claim,
                          java.lang.String claimNumber)
        Cancel a previously allocated claim number. Called in the rare case that generateNewClaimNumber is called to allocate a claim number but the claim fails validation and is subsequently canceled by the user. In this case this method is called to give the claim number generator chance to re-use the number.

        It is perfectly acceptable to leave the implementation of this method empty. It is provided for implementors who want to reduce the chance of "losing" claim numbers, so if occasional losses are acceptable there is no need to implement it. However even if this method is implemented there is still a small chance of losing a claim number - for example if there is a power failure right after allocating the claim number but before the change gets committed.

        Parameters:
        claim - The claim on which the generated claim number will be set. This claim should be treated as read-only within the context of the plugin.
        claimNumber - the number that was allocated by generateNewClaimNumber.
        See Also:
        generateNewClaimNumber(entity.Claim)
